snippet: In rural communities, where tradition has long been inviolable, the political crisis is tearing communities apart.
abstract: Turmoil shaking Egypt has extended far beyond the country's big cities, and political crisis is tearing small, rural communities apart; military-installed government and machinery of the state, including news media, have vilified Islamist supporters of ousted Pres Mohamed Morsi, calling them traitors and terrorists, causing neighbors to turn on one another and tearing families apart.
lead_paragraph: In rural communities, where tradition has long been inviolable, the political crisis is tearing communities apart.

headline.main: Reach of Turmoil in Egypt Extends Into Countryside
headline.print_headline: Reach of Turmoil in Egypt Extends Into Countryside

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
